definition[0]: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves gently from side to side
example[0]: She rocked the cradle to quieten the child.
example[1]: Like most Catholic children, he had heard stories of Ireland from the cradle.
definition[2]: a structure that is used to lift something heavy up or down
definition[3]: the part of a telephone where you put the receiver when you are not using it
example[3]: She replaced the receiver on the cradle.
definition[4]: to hold something gently, as if to protect it
example[4]: John cradled the baby in his arms.
definition[5]: to hold a telephone receiver by putting it between your ear and your shoulder
example[5]: She hunched over the desk, telephone cradled at her neck.
